messages.content:
Use the Excel diagram below to answer questions [c] to [f].
c) Name the parts labeled A, B and C in the diagram above. [3 Marks]
d) What would happen if you click the part marked D? [2 Marks]
e) The sale representatives were each given a goal of 1000 shillings. Describe how you would
use excel built in functions to complete the column for those who have passed the goal and
those who have failed to pass the goal [P/F]. Clearly state the formula you would use.

c) The part labeled A is the column header, the part labeled B is the cell, and the part labeled C is the row header.

d) If you click the part marked D, it would select the entire worksheet or spreadsheet.

e) To determine whether a sales representative has passed the goal or not, you can use the following formula:

=IF(cell_reference>1000,"P","F")

This formula checks if the value in the cell reference (where the sales amount is recorded) is greater than 1000. If it is, it returns "P" indicating that the goal was passed. If it is not, it returns "F" indicating that the goal was failed to be met. You can then apply this formula to the entire column to calculate the results for all sales representatives.

What is a spreadsheet? [2 Marks]
b) Give three examples of spreadsheets.

a) A spreadsheet is a file made up of rows and columns that can be used to organize, analyze, and manipulate data. It is commonly used for calculations, data management, and creating charts and graphs.

b) Three examples of spreadsheets are:
1) Microsoft Excel
2) Google Sheets
3) Apple Numbers
